title: Glasgow Coma Scale
description: Standardized scale for assessing level of consciousness based on eye, verbal, and motor responses.

options.label: Spontaneous
options.description: Eyes open spontaneously

options.label: To speech
options.description: Eyes open to verbal command

options.label: To pain
options.description: Eyes open to painful stimulus

options.label: None
options.description: No eye opening

options.label: Oriented
options.description: Oriented and converses

options.label: Confused
options.description: Disoriented and converses

options.label: Inappropriate words
options.description: Inappropriate words, no sustained conversation

options.label: Incomprehensible sounds
options.description: Moaning, no words

options.label: None
options.description: No verbal response

options.label: Obeys commands
options.description: Obeys commands for movement

options.label: Localizes pain
options.description: Purposeful movement toward painful stimulus

options.label: Withdrawal
options.description: Withdraws from painful stimulus

options.label: Abnormal flexion
options.description: Decorticate posturing to painful stimulus

options.label: Extension
options.description: Decerebrate posturing to painful stimulus

options.label: None
options.description: No motor response

interpretation.label: Severe brain injury
interpretation.action: Consider intubation for airway protection; neurosurgical consultation

interpretation.label: Moderate brain injury
interpretation.action: Close monitoring; serial neurological assessments

interpretation.label: Mild brain injury
interpretation.action: Monitor; assess for deterioration

citation: Teasdale G, Jennett B. Assessment of coma and impaired consciousness: a practical scale. Lancet. 1974;2(7872):81-84.

title: NIH Stroke Scale
description: Systematic assessment of neurological deficit severity in acute stroke patients across 15 items.

options.label: Alert
options.description: Keenly responsive

options.label: Not alert, arousable by minor stimulation
options.description: Drowsy but arousable to minor stimulation

options.label: Not alert, requires repeated stimulation
options.description: Requires repeated stimulation or painful stimulus for movements

options.label: Unresponsive or reflexive responses only
options.description: Reflex motor or autonomic effects only, or totally unresponsive

options.label: Answers both correctly
options.description: Correctly states month and age

options.label: Answers one correctly
options.description: Answers one question correctly

options.label: Answers neither correctly
options.description: Answers neither question correctly

options.label: Performs both correctly
options.description: Correctly performs both tasks (open/close eyes, grip/release hand)

options.label: Performs one correctly
options.description: Performs one task correctly

options.label: Performs neither correctly
options.description: Performs neither task correctly

options.label: Normal
options.description: Normal horizontal eye movements

options.label: Partial gaze palsy
options.description: Partial gaze palsy; abnormal gaze in one or both eyes but no forced deviation or total gaze paresis

options.label: Forced deviation or total gaze paresis
options.description: Forced deviation or total gaze paresis not overcome by oculocephalic maneuver

options.label: No visual loss
options.description: No visual field defect

options.label: Partial hemianopia
options.description: Partial hemianopia or extinction

options.label: Complete hemianopia
options.description: Complete hemianopia

options.label: Bilateral hemianopia or blind
options.description: Bilateral hemianopia including cortical blindness

options.label: Normal
options.description: Normal symmetric movements

options.label: Minor paralysis
options.description: Minor paralysis (flattened nasolabial fold, asymmetry on smiling)

options.label: Partial paralysis
options.description: Partial paralysis (total or near-total paralysis of lower face)

options.label: Complete paralysis
options.description: Complete paralysis of one or both sides (absence of facial movement in upper and lower face)

options.label: No drift
options.description: Limb holds 90 (or 45) degrees for full 10 seconds

options.label: Drift
options.description: Limb holds position but drifts down before full 10 seconds; does not hit bed

options.label: Some effort against gravity
options.description: Some effort against gravity; limb cannot get to or maintain 90 (or 45) degrees, drifts down to bed

options.label: No effort against gravity
options.description: No effort against gravity; limb falls immediately

options.label: No movement
options.description: No movement

options.label: No drift
options.description: Limb holds 90 (or 45) degrees for full 10 seconds

options.label: Drift
options.description: Limb holds position but drifts down before full 10 seconds; does not hit bed

options.label: Some effort against gravity
options.description: Some effort against gravity; limb cannot get to or maintain 90 (or 45) degrees, drifts down to bed

options.label: No effort against gravity
options.description: No effort against gravity; limb falls immediately

options.label: No movement
options.description: No movement

options.label: No drift
options.description: Leg holds 30-degree position for full 5 seconds

options.label: Drift
options.description: Leg drifts to intermediate position by end of 5-second period

options.label: Some effort against gravity
options.description: Some effort against gravity; leg falls to bed by 5 seconds

options.label: No effort against gravity
options.description: No effort against gravity; leg falls to bed immediately

options.label: No movement
options.description: No movement

options.label: No drift
options.description: Leg holds 30-degree position for full 5 seconds

options.label: Drift
options.description: Leg drifts to intermediate position by end of 5-second period

options.label: Some effort against gravity
options.description: Some effort against gravity; leg falls to bed by 5 seconds

options.label: No effort against gravity
options.description: No effort against gravity; leg falls to bed immediately

options.label: No movement
options.description: No movement

options.label: Absent
options.description: No ataxia

options.label: Present in one limb
options.description: Ataxia present in one limb

options.label: Present in two or more limbs
options.description: Ataxia present in two or more limbs

options.label: Normal
options.description: No sensory loss

options.label: Mild-to-moderate sensory loss
options.description: Mild-to-moderate sensory loss; patient feels pinprick is less sharp or dull on affected side

options.label: Severe or total sensory loss
options.description: Severe or total sensory loss; patient is not aware of being touched in the face, arm, and leg

options.label: No aphasia
options.description: Normal; no aphasia

options.label: Mild-to-moderate aphasia
options.description: Mild-to-moderate aphasia; some obvious loss of fluency or comprehension, without significant limitation on ideas expressed

options.label: Severe aphasia
options.description: Severe aphasia; all communication is through fragmentary expression; great need for inference and guessing by examiner

options.label: Mute or global aphasia
options.description: Mute, global aphasia; no usable speech or auditory comprehension

options.label: Normal
options.description: Normal articulation

options.label: Mild-to-moderate dysarthria
options.description: Mild-to-moderate; slurs some words, can be understood with some difficulty

options.label: Severe dysarthria
options.description: Severe; speech so slurred as to be unintelligible or mute/anarthric

options.label: No abnormality
options.description: No neglect

options.label: Inattention or extinction in one modality
options.description: Visual, tactile, auditory, spatial, or personal inattention, or extinction to bilateral simultaneous stimulation in one sensory modality

options.label: Profound hemi-inattention or extinction in more than one modality
options.description: Profound hemi-inattention or extinction to more than one modality; does not recognize own hand or orients to only one side of space

interpretation.label: Minor stroke
interpretation.action: Consider IV alteplase if within window; evaluate for underlying etiology

interpretation.label: Moderate stroke
interpretation.action: IV alteplase if within 4.5 hours; consider thrombectomy if LVO suspected

interpretation.label: Moderate-to-severe stroke
interpretation.action: IV alteplase and evaluate for mechanical thrombectomy

interpretation.label: Severe stroke
interpretation.action: IV alteplase if eligible; strong consideration for mechanical thrombectomy; ICU admission

citation: Brott T, Adams HP Jr, et al. Measurements of acute cerebral infarction: a clinical examination scale. Stroke. 1989;20(7):864-870.

title: Modified Rankin Scale
description: Global outcome scale measuring degree of disability or dependence in daily activities after stroke or neurological disability.

options.label: 0 - No symptoms
options.description: No symptoms at all

options.label: 1 - No significant disability
options.description: No significant disability despite symptoms; able to carry out all usual duties and activities

options.label: 2 - Slight disability
options.description: Unable to carry out all previous activities but able to look after own affairs without assistance

options.label: 3 - Moderate disability
options.description: Requiring some help, but able to walk without assistance

options.label: 4 - Moderately severe disability
options.description: Unable to walk and attend to bodily needs without assistance

options.label: 5 - Severe disability
options.description: Bedridden, incontinent, requiring constant nursing care and attention

options.label: 6 - Dead
options.description: Dead

interpretation.label: No significant disability
interpretation.action: Routine follow-up; secondary stroke prevention

interpretation.label: Slight disability
interpretation.action: Secondary prevention; consider rehabilitation referral

interpretation.label: Moderate disability
interpretation.action: Rehabilitation services; home health assessment

interpretation.label: Moderately severe disability
interpretation.action: Comprehensive rehabilitation; evaluate for skilled nursing facility

interpretation.label: Severe disability
interpretation.action: Long-term care planning; goals of care discussion

citation: van Swieten JC, Koudstaal PJ, et al. Interobserver agreement for the assessment of handicap in stroke patients. Stroke. 1988;19(5):604-607.

title: ABCD2 Score for TIA
description: Risk stratification tool predicting short-term stroke risk after transient ischemic attack.

options.label: BP < 140/90 mmHg
options.description: Initial blood pressure below 140/90

options.label: BP >= 140/90 mmHg
options.description: Initial blood pressure 140/90 or higher

options.label: Other symptoms
options.description: Symptoms other than weakness or speech disturbance

options.label: Speech disturbance without weakness
options.description: Speech disturbance without unilateral weakness

options.label: Unilateral weakness
options.description: Unilateral weakness with or without speech disturbance

options.label: < 10 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted less than 10 minutes

options.label: 10-59 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted 10 to 59 minutes

options.label: >= 60 minutes
options.description: Symptoms lasted 60 minutes or more

options.label: Diabetes present
options.description: History of diabetes mellitus

interpretation.label: Low risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~1%; outpatient workup may be appropriate with close follow-up

interpretation.label: Moderate risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~4%; consider hospital admission for expedited workup

interpretation.label: High risk
interpretation.action: 2-day stroke risk ~8%; hospital admission recommended for urgent evaluation and treatment

citation: Johnston SC, Rothwell PM, et al. Validation and refinement of scores to predict very early stroke risk after transient ischaemic attack. Lancet. 2007;369(9558):283-292.

title: CHA2DS2-VASc Score
description: Estimates stroke risk in patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation to guide anticoagulation decisions.

options.label: Present
options.description: History of congestive heart failure or LV dysfunction (EF <= 40%)

options.label: Present
options.description: Resting BP > 140/90 mmHg on at least 2 occasions or current antihypertensive treatment

options.label: 65-74 years
options.description: Age 65 to 74 years

options.label: 75 years or older
options.description: Age 75 years or older

options.label: Present
options.description: Fasting glucose > 125 mg/dL or treatment with oral hypoglycemic or insulin

options.label: Present
options.description: Prior stroke, TIA, or systemic thromboembolism

options.label: Present
options.description: Prior MI, peripheral artery disease, or aortic plaque

options.label: Female
options.description: Female sex

interpretation.label: Low risk
interpretation.action: No anticoagulation therapy recommended (male); if female with no other risk factors, low risk

interpretation.label: Low-moderate risk
interpretation.action: Consider oral anticoagulation or antiplatelet therapy based on individual risk-benefit assessment

interpretation.label: Moderate-high risk
interpretation.action: Oral anticoagulation recommended (DOAC preferred over warfarin unless mechanical valve or moderate-severe mitral stenosis)

citation: Lip GY, Nieuwlaat R, et al. Refining clinical risk stratification for predicting stroke and thromboembolism in atrial fibrillation using a novel risk factor-based approach: the Euro Heart Survey on Atrial Fibrillation. Chest. 2010;137(2):263-272.

title: Patient Health Questionnaire-9
description: Self-administered screening tool for depression severity based on DSM criteria, frequently used in neurology for comorbid depression assessment.

components.name: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

options.label: Several days
options.description: Several days over the last 2 weeks

options.label: More than half the days
options.description: More than half the days over the last 2 weeks

options.label: Nearly every day
options.description: Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks

components.name: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed, or being fidgety or restless
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way

interpretation.label: Minimal depression
interpretation.action: Monitor; no treatment typically indicated

interpretation.label: Mild depression
interpretation.action: Watchful waiting; consider counseling or follow-up PHQ-9

interpretation.label: Moderate depression
interpretation.action: Consider pharmacotherapy and/or psychotherapy; treatment plan recommended

interpretation.label: Moderately severe depression
interpretation.action: Active treatment with pharmacotherapy and/or psychotherapy recommended

interpretation.label: Severe depression
interpretation.action: Immediate initiation of pharmacotherapy; consider referral to psychiatry; assess for suicidality

citation: Kroenke K, Spitzer RL, Williams JB. The PHQ-9: validity of a brief depression severity measure. J Gen Intern Med. 2001;16(9):606-613.

title: Epworth Sleepiness Scale
description: Subjective measure of daytime sleepiness assessing the likelihood of dozing in eight common daily situations.

options.label: Would never doze
options.description: No chance of dozing

components.name: Sitting inactive in a public place (e.g., theater or meeting)
As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break
Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
Sitting quietly after lunch without alcohol
In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic

interpretation.label: Normal daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Unlikely pathological sleepiness

interpretation.label: Borderline sleepiness
interpretation.action: Consider further evaluation if clinical suspicion exists

interpretation.label: Excessive daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Further evaluation recommended; consider polysomnography or MSLT

interpretation.label: Severe excessive daytime sleepiness
interpretation.action: Urgent sleep medicine evaluation; polysomnography indicated; counsel on driving safety

citation: Johns MW. A new method for measuring daytime sleepiness: the Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Sleep. 1991;14(6):540-545.

title: Hunt and Hess Classification
description: Clinical grading scale for subarachnoid hemorrhage severity used to predict surgical risk and prognosis.

options.label: Grade 1
options.description: Asymptomatic or minimal headache and slight nuchal rigidity

options.label: Grade 2
options.description: Moderate to severe headache, nuchal rigidity, no neurological deficit other than cranial nerve palsy

options.label: Grade 3
options.description: Drowsy, confused, or mild focal neurological deficit

options.label: Grade 4
options.description: Stupor, moderate to severe hemiparesis, possible early decerebrate rigidity

options.label: Grade 5
options.description: Deep coma, decerebrate rigidity, moribund appearance

interpretation.label: Grade 1 - Low risk
interpretation.action: Good prognosis; surgical/endovascular treatment of aneurysm recommended

interpretation.label: Grade 2 - Low risk
interpretation.action: Good prognosis; early aneurysm treatment recommended

interpretation.label: Grade 3 - Moderate risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; early aneurysm treatment; closely monitor for vasospasm

interpretation.label: Grade 4 - High risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; stabilize before aneurysm treatment; high mortality risk; consider EVD if hydrocephalus present

interpretation.label: Grade 5 - Very high risk
interpretation.action: ICU admission; consider goals of care discussion; treatment individualized; very poor prognosis

citation: Hunt WE, Hess RM. Surgical risk as related to time of intervention in the repair of intracranial aneurysms. J Neurosurg. 1968;28(1):14-20.

title: ICH Score
description: Prognostic grading scale for intracerebral hemorrhage predicting 30-day mortality based on clinical and radiographic features.

options.label: GCS 13-15
options.description: Mild impairment or normal consciousness

options.label: GCS 5-12
options.description: Moderate impairment of consciousness

options.label: GCS 3-4
options.description: Severe impairment of consciousness

options.label: < 30 mL
options.description: ICH volume less than 30 mL (ABC/2 method)

options.label: >= 30 mL
options.description: ICH volume 30 mL or greater

options.label: No
options.description: No intraventricular extension

options.label: Yes
options.description: Intraventricular hemorrhage present on CT

options.label: No
options.description: Supratentorial hemorrhage origin

options.label: Yes
options.description: Infratentorial (cerebellar or brainstem) hemorrhage origin

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~0%
interpretation.action: Favorable prognosis; standard ICH management

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~13%
interpretation.action: ICU admission; aggressive blood pressure control; monitor for expansion

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~26%
interpretation.action: ICU admission; neurosurgical consultation; consider EVD if IVH with hydrocephalus

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~72%
interpretation.action: ICU admission; neurosurgical consultation; early goals of care discussion

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~97%
interpretation.action: Goals of care discussion; consider comfort measures vs aggressive intervention

interpretation.label: 30-day mortality ~100%
interpretation.action: Very poor prognosis; goals of care discussion with family

citation: Hemphill JC 3rd, Bonovich DC, et al. The ICH Score: a simple, reliable grading scale for intracerebral hemorrhage. Stroke. 2001;32(4):891-897.

title: Full Outline of UnResponsiveness Score
description: Coma scale providing more neurological detail than GCS, including brainstem reflexes and respiratory pattern, and can be used in intubated patients.

options.label: Eyelids remain closed with pain
options.description: No eye opening or tracking

options.label: Eyelids closed, open to pain
options.description: Eyes open to painful stimulation

options.label: Eyelids closed, open to loud voice
options.description: Eyes open to loud voice

options.label: Eyelids open but not tracking
options.description: Eyes open, not tracking or following commands

options.label: Eyelids open, tracking or blinking to command
options.description: Eyes open, tracking objects or blinking on command

options.label: No response to pain, or generalized myoclonus status
options.description: No motor response or myoclonus status epilepticus

options.label: Extension response to pain
options.description: Decerebrate posturing

options.label: Flexion response to pain
options.description: Decorticate posturing

options.label: Localizing to pain
options.description: Localizes to painful stimulus

options.label: Thumbs-up, fist, or peace sign to command
options.description: Follows specific hand-shape commands (thumbs up, fist, or peace sign)

options.label: Absent pupil, corneal, and cough reflexes
options.description: All brainstem reflexes absent

options.label: Pupil and corneal reflexes absent
options.description: Pupil and corneal reflexes both absent; cough may be present

options.label: Pupil or corneal reflex absent
options.description: Either pupil OR corneal reflex absent

options.label: One pupil wide and fixed
options.description: One pupil wide and fixed; corneal and cough reflexes present

options.label: Pupil and corneal reflexes present
options.description: Both pupil and corneal reflexes present and reactive

options.label: Breathes at ventilator rate or apnea
options.description: No respiratory drive; apnea or breathing at set ventilator rate only

options.label: Breathes above ventilator rate
options.description: Intubated, breathes above set ventilator rate

options.label: Not intubated, irregular breathing
options.description: Not intubated; irregular or Cheyne-Stokes breathing pattern

options.label: Not intubated, Cheyne-Stokes breathing
options.description: Not intubated; Cheyne-Stokes breathing pattern

options.label: Not intubated, regular breathing pattern
options.description: Not intubated; regular respiratory pattern

interpretation.label: May suggest brain death or unresponsive state
interpretation.action: Consider brain death evaluation if E0+M0+B0+R0; full ancillary testing indicated

interpretation.label: Severe impairment
interpretation.action: ICU management; frequent reassessments; consider prognostic workup (EEG, SSEP)

interpretation.label: Moderate impairment
interpretation.action: ICU admission; serial monitoring; evaluate for treatable causes

interpretation.label: Mild-moderate impairment
interpretation.action: Close monitoring; identify and treat underlying etiology

interpretation.label: Intact or near-intact responses
interpretation.action: Good prognostic sign; continue supportive care and monitoring

citation: Wijdicks EF, Bamlet WR, et al. Validation of a new coma scale: The FOUR score. Ann Neurol. 2005;58(4):585-593.

title: HAS-BLED Score
description: Estimates the risk of major bleeding in patients on anticoagulation for atrial fibrillation.

options.label: Yes
options.description: Uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >160 mmHg)

options.label: Yes
options.description: Chronic dialysis, renal transplant, or Cr ≥2.3 mg/dL

options.label: Yes
options.description: Chronic hepatic disease or bilirubin >2x ULN with AST/ALT >3x ULN

options.label: Yes
options.description: History of stroke

options.label: Yes
options.description: Previous major bleeding, anemia, or bleeding diathesis

options.label: Yes
options.description: Unstable/high INRs or <60% time in therapeutic range

options.label: Yes
options.description: Age greater than 65 years

options.label: Yes
options.description: Concomitant aspirin, clopidogrel, or NSAIDs

options.label: Yes
options.description: ≥8 drinks/week

interpretation.label: Low bleeding risk
interpretation.action: Major bleeding risk ~1%/year; anticoagulation generally safe

interpretation.label: Moderate bleeding risk
interpretation.action: Major bleeding risk 2-4%/year; anticoagulation reasonable with monitoring

interpretation.label: High bleeding risk
interpretation.action: Major bleeding risk ≥5%/year; consider modifiable risk factors; careful monitoring required

citation: Pisters R, Lane DA, et al. A novel user-friendly score (HAS-BLED) to assess 1-year risk of major bleeding in patients with atrial fibrillation. Chest. 2010;138(5):1093-1100.

title: Fisher Grade for SAH
description: CT-based grading scale for subarachnoid hemorrhage that predicts risk of vasospasm.

options.label: Grade 1
options.description: No blood detected on CT

options.label: Grade 2
options.description: Diffuse thin layer of blood (<1mm thick)

options.label: Grade 3
options.description: Localized clot and/or thick layer of blood (>1mm)

options.label: Grade 4
options.description: Intracerebral or intraventricular clot with diffuse or no SAH

interpretation.label: Grade 1 - Low vasospasm risk
interpretation.action: Vasospasm risk ~21%; standard SAH monitoring

interpretation.label: Grade 2 - Low vasospasm risk
interpretation.action: Vasospasm risk ~25%; nimodipine prophylaxis; daily TCDs

interpretation.label: Grade 3 - High vasospasm risk
interpretation.action: Vasospasm risk ~37%; aggressive monitoring with TCDs and clinical exams; consider CTA if symptomatic

interpretation.label: Grade 4 - Moderate vasospasm risk
interpretation.action: Vasospasm risk ~31%; may need EVD for IVH; monitor for hydrocephalus

citation: Fisher CM, Kistler JP, Davis JM. Relation of cerebral vasospasm to subarachnoid hemorrhage visualized by computerized tomographic scanning. Neurosurgery. 1980;6(1):1-9.

title: Modified Fisher Scale
description: Updated CT-based grading scale for SAH with improved vasospasm prediction by incorporating IVH.

options.label: Grade 0
options.description: No SAH or IVH

options.label: Grade 1
options.description: Thin SAH, no IVH

options.label: Grade 2
options.description: Thin SAH with IVH

options.label: Grade 3
options.description: Thick SAH, no IVH

options.label: Grade 4
options.description: Thick SAH with IVH

interpretation.label: Grade 0 - Minimal risk
interpretation.action: Symptomatic vasospasm risk 0%; standard monitoring

interpretation.label: Grade 1 - Low risk
interpretation.action: Symptomatic vasospasm risk ~24%; nimodipine; TCD monitoring

interpretation.label: Grade 2 - Moderate risk
interpretation.action: Symptomatic vasospasm risk ~33%; aggressive TCD monitoring; may need EVD

interpretation.label: Grade 3 - High risk
interpretation.action: Symptomatic vasospasm risk ~33%; daily TCDs; prepare for angiography if symptomatic

interpretation.label: Grade 4 - Very high risk
interpretation.action: Symptomatic vasospasm risk ~40%; EVD likely needed; aggressive TCD and clinical monitoring

citation: Frontera JA, Claassen J, et al. Prediction of symptomatic vasospasm after subarachnoid hemorrhage: the modified Fisher scale. Neurosurgery. 2006;59(1):21-27.

title: Barthel Index
description: Measures functional independence in activities of daily living, commonly used for stroke rehabilitation outcomes.

options.label: Unable
options.description: Unable to feed self

options.label: Needs help
options.description: Needs help cutting, spreading butter, etc.

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent in feeding

options.label: Dependent
options.description: Dependent in bathing

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent in bathing (shower, tub, or sponge bath)

options.label: Needs help
options.description: Needs help with personal care

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent face/hair/teeth/shaving

options.label: Dependent
options.description: Dependent in dressing

options.label: Needs help
options.description: Needs help but can do about half unaided

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent including buttons, zips, laces

options.label: Incontinent
options.description: Incontinent or needs enemas

options.label: Occasional accident
options.description: Occasional accident (once per week)

options.label: Continent
options.description: Continent

options.label: Incontinent or catheterized
options.description: Incontinent or catheterized and unable to manage

options.label: Occasional accident
options.description: Occasional accident (max once per 24 hours)

options.label: Continent
options.description: Continent (for over 7 days)

options.label: Dependent
options.description: Dependent in toilet use

options.label: Needs some help
options.description: Needs some help but can do something alone

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent (on and off, dressing, wiping)

options.label: Unable
options.description: Unable, no sitting balance

options.label: Major help
options.description: Major help (1-2 people, physical)

options.label: Minor help
options.description: Minor help (verbal or physical)

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent

options.label: Immobile
options.description: Immobile or <50 yards

options.label: Wheelchair independent
options.description: Wheelchair independent, including corners, >50 yards

options.label: Walks with help
options.description: Walks with help of one person (verbal or physical) >50 yards

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent (may use aid) >50 yards

options.label: Unable
options.description: Unable to climb stairs

options.label: Needs help
options.description: Needs help (verbal, physical, carrying aid)

options.label: Independent
options.description: Independent up and down

interpretation.label: Total dependence
interpretation.action: Requires nursing home level care or 24-hour assistance

interpretation.label: Severe dependence
interpretation.action: Requires significant daily assistance; inpatient rehabilitation indicated

interpretation.label: Moderate dependence
interpretation.action: Needs some assistance; home with services or outpatient rehabilitation

interpretation.label: Slight dependence
interpretation.action: Minimal assistance needed; likely safe for home discharge

interpretation.label: Independent
interpretation.action: Functionally independent in ADLs

citation: Mahoney FI, Barthel DW. Functional evaluation: the Barthel Index. Md State Med J. 1965;14:61-65.

title: Mini-Mental State Examination
description: Brief 30-point screening questionnaire for cognitive impairment assessing orientation, memory, attention, language, and visuospatial skills.

options.label: 0 correct
options.description: Cannot answer any time orientation questions

options.label: 5 correct
options.description: Correctly states year, season, month, date, day of week

options.label: 0 correct
options.description: Cannot answer any place orientation questions

options.label: 5 correct
options.description: Correctly states state, county, city, building, floor

options.label: 3 words
options.description: Immediately repeats all 3 words correctly

components.name: Attention and Calculation (Serial 7s or WORLD backwards)

options.label: 5 correct
options.description: Serial 7s (93,86,79,72,65) or WORLD spelled backwards correctly

options.label: 3 words
options.description: Recalls all 3 words after delay

options.label: 2 correct
options.description: Correctly names both pencil and watch

options.label: Unable
options.description: Cannot repeat phrase

options.label: Correct
options.description: Correctly repeats 'No ifs, ands, or buts'

options.label: 3 steps
options.description: Correctly follows: Take paper in right hand, fold in half, put on floor

options.label: Unable
options.description: Cannot read or follow written command

options.label: Correct
options.description: Reads and obeys 'Close your eyes'

options.label: Unable
options.description: Cannot write a sentence

options.label: Correct
options.description: Writes a complete, sensible sentence

options.label: Unable
options.description: Cannot copy figure

options.label: Correct
options.description: Correctly copies intersecting pentagons with 5 sides and intersection

interpretation.label: Severe cognitive impairment
interpretation.action: Comprehensive dementia evaluation; assess for reversible causes; care planning; safety assessment

interpretation.label: Moderate cognitive impairment
interpretation.action: Dementia workup indicated; assess functional status; consider neuroimaging and labs

interpretation.label: Mild cognitive impairment
interpretation.action: Further cognitive testing (MoCA); consider MCI vs early dementia; monitor progression

interpretation.label: Normal cognition
interpretation.action: No evidence of dementia; consider education/cultural factors if clinical suspicion persists

citation: Folstein MF, Folstein SE, McHugh PR. 'Mini-mental state'. A practical method for grading the cognitive state of patients for the clinician. J Psychiatr Res. 1975;12(3):189-198.

title: Montreal Cognitive Assessment
description: 30-point screening tool for mild cognitive impairment, more sensitive than MMSE for executive function and attention.

options.label: 5 points
options.description: Trail-making, cube copy, clock drawing (5 pts total)

options.label: 3 correct
options.description: Names lion, rhinoceros, camel

options.label: 6 points
options.description: Digit span, vigilance, serial 7s (6 pts total)

options.label: 3 points
options.description: Sentence repetition and verbal fluency (3 pts total)

options.label: 2 correct
options.description: Correctly identifies similarities (train-bicycle, watch-ruler)

options.label: 5 words
options.description: Recalls all 5 words (face, velvet, church, daisy, red)

options.label: 6 correct
options.description: Date, month, year, day, place, city (6 pts)

interpretation.label: Moderate-severe impairment
interpretation.action: Comprehensive dementia evaluation; neuroimaging; assess for reversible causes

interpretation.label: Mild cognitive impairment
interpretation.action: MCI likely; consider etiology workup; longitudinal monitoring; lifestyle modifications

interpretation.label: Normal cognition
interpretation.action: Score ≥26 considered normal; add 1 point if ≤12 years education

citation: Nasreddine ZS, Phillips NA, et al. The Montreal Cognitive Assessment, MoCA: a brief screening tool for mild cognitive impairment. J Am Geriatr Soc. 2005;53(4):695-699.

title: Mini-Cog
description: Rapid 3-minute screening test for cognitive impairment using 3-word recall and clock drawing.

options.label: 3 words recalled
options.description: Recalls all 3 words after clock drawing

options.label: Abnormal
options.description: Clock not drawn correctly (numbers or hands incorrect)

options.label: Normal
options.description: All numbers present in correct position; hands show requested time

interpretation.label: Positive screen for dementia
interpretation.action: High probability of dementia; comprehensive evaluation indicated

interpretation.label: Negative screen
interpretation.action: Lower probability of dementia; consider further testing if clinical suspicion

citation: Borson S, Scanlan J, et al. The Mini-Cog: a cognitive 'vital signs' measure for dementia screening in multi-lingual elderly. Int J Geriatr Psychiatry. 2000;15(11):1021-1027.

title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item
description: Brief self-report screening tool for generalized anxiety disorder, commonly used alongside PHQ-9.

components.name: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge

options.label: Several days
options.description: Several days over the last 2 weeks

components.name: Not being able to stop or control worrying
Worrying too much about different things
Being so restless that it's hard to sit still
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

interpretation.label: Minimal anxiety
interpretation.action: Monitor; no treatment typically indicated

interpretation.label: Mild anxiety
interpretation.action: Watchful waiting; consider counseling; repeat GAD-7 at follow-up

interpretation.label: Moderate anxiety
interpretation.action: Consider pharmacotherapy (SSRI/SNRI) and/or CBT; further evaluation

interpretation.label: Severe anxiety
interpretation.action: Active treatment indicated; pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy; consider psychiatry referral

citation: Spitzer RL, Kroenke K, et al. A brief measure for assessing generalized anxiety disorder: the GAD-7. Arch Intern Med. 2006;166(10):1092-1097.

title: Hoehn and Yahr Scale
description: Staging system for Parkinson's disease severity based on motor symptoms and functional disability.

options.label: Stage 0 - No signs of disease
options.description: No signs of disease

options.label: Stage 1 - Unilateral only
options.description: Unilateral involvement only

options.label: Stage 1.5 - Unilateral + axial
options.description: Unilateral and axial involvement

options.label: Stage 2 - Bilateral, balance intact
options.description: Bilateral involvement without impairment of balance

options.label: Stage 2.5 - Mild bilateral, pull test recovery
options.description: Mild bilateral disease with recovery on pull test

options.label: Stage 3 - Postural instability
options.description: Mild to moderate bilateral disease; some postural instability; physically independent

options.label: Stage 4 - Severe disability
options.description: Severe disability; still able to walk or stand unassisted

options.label: Stage 5 - Wheelchair/bedridden
options.description: Wheelchair bound or bedridden unless aided

interpretation.label: No disease
interpretation.action: No treatment indicated; consider alternative diagnosis if symptoms present

interpretation.label: Stage 1-1.5 - Unilateral
interpretation.action: Early PD; consider MAO-B inhibitor or dopamine agonist; physical therapy

interpretation.label: Stage 2-2.5 - Bilateral, balance intact
interpretation.action: Moderate PD; levodopa or dopamine agonist; exercise program; PT/OT evaluation

interpretation.label: Stage 3 - Postural instability
interpretation.action: Fall risk; optimize medications; PT for balance; home safety evaluation

interpretation.label: Stage 4 - Severe disability
interpretation.action: Advanced PD; consider device-aided therapies (DBS, pump); caregiver support

interpretation.label: Stage 5 - Wheelchair/bedridden
interpretation.action: Focus on symptom management and quality of life; palliative care discussion

citation: Hoehn MM, Yahr MD. Parkinsonism: onset, progression and mortality. Neurology. 1967;17(5):427-442.

title: Schwab and England ADL Scale
description: Measures independence in activities of daily living in Parkinson's disease patients.

options.label: 100% - Completely independent
options.description: Able to do all chores without slowness, difficulty, or impairment

options.label: 90% - Completely independent
options.description: Able to do all chores with some slowness, difficulty, or impairment; may take twice as long

options.label: 80% - Independent in most chores
options.description: Takes twice as long; conscious of difficulty and slowing

options.label: 70% - Not completely independent
options.description: More difficulty with chores; 3-4x as long for some; large part of day for chores

options.label: 60% - Some dependency
options.description: Can do most chores but very slowly and with much effort; errors; some impossible

options.label: 50% - More dependent
options.description: Needs help with half of chores; slower; difficulty with everything

options.label: 40% - Very dependent
options.description: Can assist with all chores but few alone

options.label: 30% - With effort, does few chores alone
options.description: Needs much help; very slow with everything

options.label: 20% - Nothing alone
options.description: Can be of slight help with some chores; severe invalid

options.label: 10% - Total dependence
options.description: Helpless; complete invalid

options.label: 0% - Bedridden
options.description: Vegetative functions only; bedridden

interpretation.label: Independent
interpretation.action: Functionally independent; continue current management; annual reassessment

interpretation.label: Semi-independent
interpretation.action: Increasing support needed; optimize PD therapy; OT evaluation; caregiver involvement

interpretation.label: Dependent
interpretation.action: Significant assistance required; home health evaluation; device-aided therapy consideration

interpretation.label: Total dependence
interpretation.action: Full-time care required; goals of care discussion; palliative care referral

citation: Schwab RS, England AC. Projection technique for evaluating surgery in Parkinson's disease. In: Gillingham FJ, Donaldson MC, eds. Third Symposium on Parkinson's Disease. Edinburgh: Livingstone; 1969:152-157.

title: MRC Sum Score
description: Summation of MRC grades from 6 bilateral muscle groups (12 total) to assess generalized weakness.

interpretation.label: Severe weakness
interpretation.action: ICU-level monitoring; check respiratory function (FVC); consider ventilatory support

interpretation.label: Moderate-severe weakness
interpretation.action: Frequent reassessment; monitor respiratory status; prepare for possible ICU transfer

interpretation.label: Moderate weakness
interpretation.action: Close monitoring; daily strength assessments; PT/OT evaluation

interpretation.label: Normal to mild weakness
interpretation.action: Within normal limits (60=perfect); continue management

citation: Medical Research Council. Aids to the examination of the peripheral nervous system. London: Her Majesty's Stationery Office; 1976.

title: MGFA Clinical Classification
description: Myasthenia Gravis Foundation of America classification of disease severity.

options.label: Class I - Ocular only
options.description: Any ocular muscle weakness; may have weakness of eye closure; all other muscle strength is normal

options.label: Class II - Mild generalized
options.description: Mild weakness affecting muscles other than ocular muscles; may also have ocular muscle weakness of any severity

options.label: Class IIa - Predominantly limb/axial
options.description: Predominantly affecting limb, axial muscles, or both; may also have lesser involvement of oropharyngeal muscles

options.label: Class IIb - Predominantly bulbar
options.description: Predominantly affecting oropharyngeal, respiratory muscles, or both; may also have lesser involvement of limb, axial muscles

options.label: Class III - Moderate generalized
options.description: Moderate weakness affecting muscles other than ocular muscles; may also have ocular muscle weakness of any severity

options.label: Class IIIa - Predominantly limb/axial
options.description: Predominantly affecting limb, axial muscles, or both; may have lesser involvement of oropharyngeal muscles

options.label: Class IIIb - Predominantly bulbar
options.description: Predominantly affecting oropharyngeal, respiratory muscles, or both; may have lesser involvement of limb, axial muscles

options.label: Class IV - Severe generalized
options.description: Severe weakness affecting muscles other than ocular muscles; may also have ocular muscle weakness of any severity

options.label: Class IVa - Predominantly limb/axial
options.description: Predominantly affecting limb, axial muscles, or both; may have lesser involvement of oropharyngeal muscles

options.label: Class IVb - Predominantly bulbar
options.description: Predominantly affecting oropharyngeal, respiratory muscles, or both; may have lesser involvement of limb, axial muscles

options.label: Class V - Intubation required
options.description: Intubation required with or without mechanical ventilation, except when used during routine postoperative management

interpretation.label: Class I - Ocular MG
interpretation.action: Pyridostigmine; consider immunotherapy if symptomatic; low risk of generalization in first 2 years

interpretation.label: Class II - Mild generalized
interpretation.action: Pyridostigmine; prednisone and/or steroid-sparing agent; thymectomy consideration

interpretation.label: Class III - Moderate generalized
interpretation.action: Aggressive immunotherapy; consider IVIg or PLEX for rapid response; thymectomy if indicated

interpretation.label: Class IV - Severe generalized
interpretation.action: Urgent immunotherapy (IVIg/PLEX); close respiratory monitoring; ICU consideration

interpretation.label: Class V - Myasthenic crisis
interpretation.action: ICU admission; intubation; IVIg or PLEX; hold pyridostigmine initially; identify trigger

citation: Jaretzki A 3rd, Barohn RJ, et al. Myasthenia gravis: recommendations for clinical research standards. Neurology. 2000;55(1):16-23.

title: GBS Disability Scale
description: Measures functional disability in Guillain-Barré syndrome for monitoring disease progression and treatment response.

options.label: 0 - Healthy
options.description: A healthy state

options.label: 1 - Minor symptoms
options.description: Minor symptoms and capable of running

options.label: 2 - Walks independently
options.description: Able to walk 10m or more without assistance but unable to run

options.label: 3 - Walks with aid
options.description: Able to walk 10m across open space with help

options.label: 4 - Bedbound or chairbound
options.description: Bedbound or chairbound

options.label: 5 - Requires assisted ventilation
options.description: Requires assisted ventilation for at least part of the day

options.label: 6 - Dead
options.description: Dead

interpretation.label: Mild/resolved
interpretation.action: Outpatient management; PT/OT; monitor for relapse

interpretation.label: Ambulatory without aid
interpretation.action: Consider IVIg/PLEX if still progressing; inpatient or close outpatient monitoring

interpretation.label: Ambulatory with assistance
interpretation.action: IVIg or PLEX indicated; monitor respiratory function (FVC q4-6h); inpatient admission

interpretation.label: Bedbound
interpretation.action: IVIg or PLEX; ICU if FVC declining; DVT prophylaxis; aggressive PT

interpretation.label: Ventilator dependent
interpretation.action: ICU management; IVIg/PLEX if not completed; tracheostomy consideration if prolonged

citation: Hughes RA, Newsom-Davis JM, et al. Controlled trial of prednisolone in acute polyneuropathy. Lancet. 1978;2(8093):750-753.

title: Expanded Disability Status Scale
description: Standard scale for quantifying disability in multiple sclerosis across 8 functional systems.

options.label: 0.0 - Normal neurological exam
options.description: Normal neurological exam in all functional systems

options.label: 1.0 - No disability, minimal signs
options.description: No disability, minimal signs in one FS

options.label: 1.5 - No disability, minimal signs (>1 FS)
options.description: No disability, minimal signs in more than one FS

options.label: 2.0 - Minimal disability
options.description: Minimal disability in one FS

options.label: 2.5 - Minimal disability (2 FS)
options.description: Minimal disability in two FS

options.label: 3.0 - Moderate disability (1 FS) or mild (3-4 FS)
options.description: Fully ambulatory; moderate disability in one FS or mild disability in 3-4 FS

options.label: 3.5 - Fully ambulatory but moderate disability
options.description: Fully ambulatory with moderate disability in one FS and mild in 1-2 others

options.label: 4.0 - Ambulatory without aid ≥500m
options.description: Fully ambulatory without aid, up and about 12hrs/day despite relatively severe disability; able to walk ≥500m without aid/rest

options.label: 4.5 - Ambulatory without aid ≥300m
options.description: Fully ambulatory without aid; up most of day; may require minimal assistance; able to work full day; relatively severe disability; able to walk ≥300m without aid/rest

options.label: 5.0 - Ambulatory ≥200m without aid
options.description: Ambulatory without aid for ≥200m; disability precludes full daily activities

options.label: 5.5 - Ambulatory ≥100m without aid
options.description: Ambulatory without aid for ≥100m; disability precludes full daily activities

options.label: 6.0 - Intermittent or unilateral constant assist
options.description: Intermittent or unilateral constant assistance (cane, crutch, brace) required to walk ≥100m with or without resting

options.label: 6.5 - Constant bilateral assistance
options.description: Constant bilateral assistance (canes, crutches, braces) required to walk ≥20m without resting

options.label: 7.0 - Unable to walk >5m; wheelchair
options.description: Unable to walk beyond 5m even with aid; essentially restricted to wheelchair; wheels self and transfers alone

options.label: 7.5 - Unable to take more than few steps
options.description: Unable to take more than a few steps; restricted to wheelchair; may need aid to transfer

options.label: 8.0 - Essentially restricted to bed/chair
options.description: Essentially restricted to bed or chair or perambulated in wheelchair; may be out of bed much of day; retains self-care functions; generally effective use of arms

options.label: 8.5 - Essentially restricted to bed much of day
options.description: Essentially restricted to bed much of day; some effective use of arms; retains some self-care functions

options.label: 9.0 - Helpless bed patient
options.description: Helpless bed patient; can communicate and eat

options.label: 9.5 - Totally helpless
options.description: Totally helpless bed patient; unable to communicate effectively or eat/swallow

options.label: 10.0 - Death due to MS
options.description: Death due to MS

interpretation.label: No/minimal disability
interpretation.action: Early MS or stable disease; continue disease-modifying therapy; annual MRI

interpretation.label: Mild disability
interpretation.action: Consider higher-efficacy DMT if progression; PT/OT evaluation; symptom management

interpretation.label: Moderate disability
interpretation.action: Walking impairment developing; consider DMT optimization; rehabilitation services; mobility aids

interpretation.label: Walking with assistance
interpretation.action: Transition to walking aids; progressive MS evaluation; symptomatic therapies

interpretation.label: Wheelchair dependent
interpretation.action: Focus on quality of life; PT/OT for transfers; home modifications; caregiver support

interpretation.label: Severe disability/death
interpretation.action: Palliative care focus; goals of care discussion; comfort measures

citation: Kurtzke JF. Rating neurologic impairment in multiple sclerosis: an expanded disability status scale (EDSS). Neurology. 1983;33(11):1444-1452.

title: Headache Impact Test-6
description: Six-item questionnaire measuring the impact of headaches on daily functioning and quality of life.

components.name: When you have headaches, how often is the pain severe?
How often do headaches limit your ability to do usual daily activities?
When you have a headache, how often do you wish you could lie down?
In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt too tired to do work or daily activities because of your headaches?
In the past 4 weeks, how often have you felt fed up or irritated because of your headaches?
In the past 4 weeks, how often did headaches limit your ability to concentrate on work or daily activities?

interpretation.label: Little to no impact
interpretation.action: Headaches have minimal impact; acute treatment as needed; lifestyle modifications

interpretation.label: Some impact
interpretation.action: Headaches affecting some activities; consider prophylactic therapy; headache diary

interpretation.label: Substantial impact
interpretation.action: Prophylactic therapy likely indicated; specialist referral consideration; trigger management

interpretation.label: Severe impact
interpretation.action: Aggressive prophylaxis; headache specialist referral; evaluate for medication overuse; consider CGRP inhibitors

citation: Kosinski M, Bayliss MS, et al. A six-item short-form survey for measuring headache impact: the HIT-6. Qual Life Res. 2003;12(8):963-974.

title: Migraine Disability Assessment
description: Questionnaire assessing headache-related disability over the past 3 months to guide treatment decisions.

components.name: Days missed from work or school
Days productivity reduced by half or more at work/school
Days productivity reduced by half or more in household work
Days missed from family, social, or leisure activities

interpretation.label: Grade I - Minimal disability
interpretation.action: Little or no disability; acute treatment adequate; consider OTC options

interpretation.label: Grade II - Mild disability
interpretation.action: Mild disability; optimize acute treatment; consider prophylaxis if frequent attacks

interpretation.label: Grade III - Moderate disability
interpretation.action: Moderate disability; prophylactic therapy indicated; headache diary; trigger identification

interpretation.label: Grade IV - Severe disability
interpretation.action: Severe disability; aggressive prophylaxis required; specialist referral; consider injectable therapies (CGRP)

citation: Stewart WF, Lipton RB, et al. Development and testing of the Migraine Disability Assessment (MIDAS) questionnaire to assess headache-related disability. Neurology. 2001;56(6 Suppl 1):S20-28.

title: STOP-BANG Questionnaire
description: Screening tool for obstructive sleep apnea risk assessment.

options.label: Yes
options.description: Louder than talking or loud enough to be heard through closed doors

components.name: Tired: Do you often feel tired, fatigued, or sleepy during daytime?
Observed: Has anyone observed you stop breathing during sleep?
Pressure: Do you have or are being treated for high blood pressure?

options.label: Yes
options.description: BMI > 35 kg/m²

options.label: Yes
options.description: Age > 50 years

options.label: Yes
options.description: Neck circumference > 40cm

interpretation.label: Low risk for OSA
interpretation.action: Low probability of moderate-severe OSA; PSG if clinical suspicion persists

interpretation.label: Intermediate risk for OSA
interpretation.action: Intermediate risk; consider home sleep apnea test or PSG

interpretation.label: High risk for OSA
interpretation.action: High probability of moderate-severe OSA; PSG recommended; consider empiric CPAP trial if severe symptoms

citation: Chung F, Yegneswaran B, et al. STOP questionnaire: a tool to screen patients for obstructive sleep apnea. Anesthesiology. 2008;108(5):812-821.

title: Rancho Los Amigos Scale
description: Scale describing cognitive and behavioral recovery stages following traumatic brain injury.

options.label: Level I - No Response
options.description: Unresponsive to all stimuli

options.label: Level II - Generalized Response
options.description: Inconsistent, non-purposeful, non-specific reactions to stimuli; responds to pain with physiologic changes

options.label: Level III - Localized Response
options.description: Inconsistent responses directly related to type of stimulus; may follow simple commands in inconsistent, delayed manner

options.label: Level IV - Confused-Agitated
options.description: Heightened state of activity with severely decreased ability to process information; bizarre behavior, no short-term recall

options.label: Level V - Confused-Inappropriate
options.description: Appears alert; responds to simple commands fairly consistently; highly distractible; memory severely impaired; inappropriate verbalization

options.label: Level VI - Confused-Appropriate
options.description: Follows simple directions consistently; memory and attention improving; goal-directed behavior with cuing; appropriate to familiar settings

options.label: Level VII - Automatic-Appropriate
options.description: Oriented in familiar settings; routine automatic; robot-like; minimal confusion; shallow recall; poor insight into condition

options.label: Level VIII - Purposeful-Appropriate
options.description: Oriented and responds appropriately; recalls and integrates past events; new learning possible; may have decreased tolerance for stress

interpretation.label: Levels I-II: No/Generalized Response
interpretation.action: ICU level care; prevent secondary injury; assess for meaningful recovery signs; family education

interpretation.label: Level III: Localized Response
interpretation.action: Emerging from coma; consistent sensory stimulation; monitor for agitation; rehab evaluation

interpretation.label: Level IV: Confused-Agitated
interpretation.action: Structured environment; minimize stimulation; safety measures; behavioral management; family support

interpretation.label: Level V: Confused-Inappropriate
interpretation.action: Structured rehabilitation; memory aids; supervision required; advance therapy as tolerated

interpretation.label: Level VI: Confused-Appropriate
interpretation.action: Active rehabilitation; increasing independence with cueing; memory strategies; community reintegration planning

interpretation.label: Level VII: Automatic-Appropriate
interpretation.action: Outpatient rehabilitation; vocational assessment; supervised community activities; insight development

interpretation.label: Level VIII: Purposeful-Appropriate
interpretation.action: Independent or supervised living; vocational rehabilitation; community reintegration; long-term follow-up

citation: Hagen C, Malkmus D, Durham P. Levels of Cognitive Functioning. Rehabilitation of the Head Injured Adult: Comprehensive Physical Management. Downey, CA: Professional Staff Association of Rancho Los Amigos Hospital; 1972.
